bill_title: revise certain provisions pertaining to the labeling of foreign meat.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions pertaining to the labeling of foreign meat. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 39-5-5 be amended to read as follows: 39-5-5. Any person who knowingly sells or offers for sale any meat which is the product of any foreign country or imported from without the boundaries of the United States, or any meat product containing such imported meat, without indicating this fact by display of a conspicuous sign in his the person's place of business and by labels or brands on each quarter, half , or whole carcass of such meat, or on each can, case , or package containing any of the above-mentioned product, naming the country of its origin and the date of exportation is guilty of a Class 2 misdemeanor. The Department of Commerce and Regulation shall conduct inspections to monitor compliance with the provisions of this section and shall report violations to the attorney general. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
